meanings.definition: A magazine that is designed to look like a catalog, typically containing advertisements and editorial content.
meanings.sent1: I enjoy reading the magalog because it has interesting articles and beautiful pictures.
meanings.sent2: The magalog I received in the mail had a lot of fashion ads and product reviews.
meanings.sent3: My friend thought the magalog was a catalog at first, but then realized it was a magazine.
meanings.sent4: The magalog was a blend of a catalog and a magazine, making it unique and appealing.
meanings.sent5: The colorful magalog caught my eye with its mix of ads and articles.

meanings.definition: To create or produce a magalog.
meanings.sent1: She will magalog the new issue of the magazine for the upcoming event.
meanings.sent2: The marketing team decided to magalog the promotional material for the product launch.
meanings.sent3: I magalogged the content for the brochure to make it more engaging for readers.
meanings.sent4: The designer will magalog the layout to ensure it resembles a catalog but reads like a magazine.
meanings.sent5: He magalogs each issue with care to maintain the balance between ads and articles.
